steps.title: Combine the sugar, cocoa powder, and salt in a saucepan.
steps.content: Combine the sugar, cocoa powder, and salt in a saucepan. Pour the sugar into a small saucepan. Add the unsweetened cocoa powder and a dash of salt. Stir everything together with a whisk. This recipe will make lots of chocolate syrup, which you can add to plain milk.

steps.title: Stir in the water.
steps.content: Stir in the water. Don't worry if the mixture looks too watery and not syrupy. The next step will help thicken it up!

steps.title: Heat the syrup.
steps.content: Heat the syrup. Bring the syrup to a boil over medium-high to high heat, stirring from time to time. Once the syrup starts to boil, reduce it to a simmer over low heat. Cook the syrup for 1 minute. You may notice that it is starting to thicken.

steps.title: Stir in the vanilla extract.
steps.content: Stir in the vanilla extract. This is not completely necessary, but it will help give the chocolate milk more flavor.

steps.title: Allow the syrup to cool before storing it in the fridge.
steps.content: Allow the syrup to cool before storing it in the fridge. This can take some time. If you are in a hurry, you can chill it in front of a fan or using an ice bath. Once it has cooled, pour it into a clean jar or bottle. Screw the cap on, then store the syrup in the refrigerator. Don't put the hot syrup in the fridge. It can change the interior temperature and spoil the surrounding food.

steps.title: Use the syrup to make chocolate milk.
steps.content: Use the syrup to make chocolate milk. When you want to have some chocolate milk, pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of milk into a glass. Add 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of your homemade chocolate syrup, and stir well. Add some ice, if desired. If you want hot chocolate, make the chocolate milk in a mug, then heat it in the microwave. [4] X Research source If you want a chocolate milkshake, combine 1 cup (240 milliliters) of milk, ¼ cup (60 milliliters) of the chocolate syrup, and 2 cups (288 grams) of vanilla ice cream in a blender. steps.title: Combine the sugar, cocoa powder, and salt.
steps.content: Combine the sugar, cocoa powder, and salt. You can do this in a blender or food processor. You can also put everything into a jar, close the lid, and shake it.

steps.title: Store the chocolate powder in a sealed container.
steps.content: Store the chocolate powder in a sealed container. You can store the powder in a glass jar, or in a plastic box with a tight-fitting lid. This is your chocolate powder. It will last you several servings!

steps.title: Combine some of the chocolate powder with a little bit of warm water.
steps.content: Combine some of the chocolate powder with a little bit of warm water. When you are ready to make some chocolate milk, measure out 1 to 2 tablespoons (7.5 to 15 grams) of your chocolate powder, and put it into a glass. Stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 milliliters) of warm water to help dissolve the powder.

steps.title: Fill the rest of the glass with milk.
steps.content: Fill the rest of the glass with milk. Once the powder has dissolved, pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of milk into the glass. Give it a stir, then drink the chocolate milk. Add some ice cubes to make it nice and cold. Store the rest of the chocolate milk powder for later.

steps.title: Serve the chocolate milk.
steps.content: Serve the chocolate milk. Enjoy it while it is still cold. To make it even more refreshing, add in some ice cubes.

steps.title: Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of cold milk into a tall glass.
steps.content: Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of cold milk into a tall glass. You can use any type of milk you want, but whole milk will taste the best. If you are vegan or allergic to dairy, try almond, coconut, or soy milk instead.

steps.title: Stir in 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of chocolate syrup.
steps.content: Stir in 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of chocolate syrup. You can use any type of chocolate syrup you want. The kind that you use to make hot chocolate would be the best. You can also use the kind that you pour on top of ice cream. Stir the chocolate in with a fork or spoon. Make sure that there's no chocolate left clumped at the bottom. Use a blender if you want to create a foamy chocolate milk.

steps.title: Add some extra flavors, if desired.
steps.content: Add some extra flavors, if desired. Give your chocolate milk a taste. Does it need more sugar? If so, add in a little bit of sugar. You can also use ¼ teaspoon of your favorite extract, such as almond or vanilla for extra flavor. If the chocolate milk is too sweet, add in a tiny pinch of salt. Stir the chocolate milk again. For an extra kick, add in a pinch of ground cinnamon.

steps.title: Serve the chocolate milk.
steps.content: Serve the chocolate milk. You can serve it as is, or make it even fancier by adding in a straw and some ice cubes. You could even garnish it with some whipped cream.

steps.title: Combine the dry ingredients in a tall glass.
steps.content: Combine the dry ingredients in a tall glass. Get out a glass that's large enough to hold at least 2 cups (475 milliliters) of liquid. Pour in the cocoa powder, sugar, and salt. Stir everything together with a fork.

steps.title: Add in the hot water.
steps.content: Add in the hot water. Heat up some water in a kettle, on the stove, or in the microwave. Measure out 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) and pour it into the glass. You can also use hot water from the tap. It would be best if it's filtered.

steps.title: Stir the mixture until a paste forms.
steps.content: Stir the mixture until a paste forms. You can do this with a mini whisk or with a fork. Keep stirring until the cocoa powder, sugar, and salt dissolve. You will get something that looks like melted chocolate.

steps.title: Pour in 2 cups (475 milliliters) of cold milk.
steps.content: Pour in 2 cups (475 milliliters) of cold milk. Give the chocolate milk a stir to make sure that everything mixes together. If you want to give your chocolate milk extra flavor, add in ¼ teaspoon of vanilla extract.

steps.title: Serve the chocolate milk.
steps.content: Serve the chocolate milk. Pop in a straw and some ice cubes, if desired. Enjoy the chocolate milk while it is still ice-cold. If this is too much for you, divide the chocolate milk between two glasses and share it with a friend!
